comments.body: should this class be called `ConnectLoggingContext` to avoid similarities it from `LogContext`.

@wicknicks can you clarify how a similarity in name here would be problematic? Unless the two are used in the same class it doesn't seem like that'd be an issue; you can always use the package name to help differentiate between the two when figuring out which one to import.
Plus, although it's unlikely, this class may come in handy in other contexts besides Connect.
Nit: may want to just move this line outside the two `if` statements since it's executed in both branches and IIUC exactly one of the branches is intended to run every time this method is invoked.

It's actually possible for the scope to be OFFSET (for example) but for the task number to be non-null (e.g., the offsets for connector "foo" task 3). In this case, both if-blocks will be entered, and moving the `sb.append("|");` out of the if blocks will not produce the correct output.
Agh, sorry, missed that. Thanks for the clarification.
